task.name: Execute Workflow
task.objective: Execute given workflow by loading its configuration, following instructions, and producing output

llm.mandate: Always read COMPLETE files - NEVER use offset/limit when reading any workflow related files
Instructions are MANDATORY - either as file path, steps or embedded list in YAML, XML or markdown
Execute ALL steps in instructions IN EXACT ORDER
Save to template output file after EVERY "template-output" tag
NEVER skip a step - YOU are responsible for every steps execution without fail or excuse

WORKFLOW-RULES.rule: Steps execute in exact numerical order (1, 2, 3...)
Optional steps: Ask user unless #yolo mode active
Template-output tags: Save content, discuss with the user the section completed, and NEVER proceed until the users indicates to proceed (unless YOLO mode has been activated)

substep.title: Load Configuration and Resolve Variables
substep.phase: Load external config from config_source path
Resolve all {config_source}: references with values from config
Ask user for input of any variables that are still unknown

substep.title: Load Required Components
substep.mandate: Instructions: Read COMPLETE file from path OR embedded list (REQUIRED)
substep.check: If template path → Read COMPLETE template file
If validation path → Note path for later loading when needed
If template: false → Mark as action-workflow (else template-workflow)
substep.note: Data files (csv, json) → Store paths only, load on-demand when instructions reference them

substep.title: Initialize Output
substep.action: Resolve default_output_file path with all variables and {{date}}
Create output directory if doesn't exist
If template-workflow → Write template to output file with placeholders

step.title: Process Each Instruction Step in Order

substep.title: Handle Step Attributes
substep.check: If optional="true" and NOT #yolo → Ask user to include
If for-each="item" → Repeat step for each item
If repeat="n" → Repeat step n times

substep.title: Execute Step Content
substep.action: Process step instructions (markdown or XML tags)
Replace {{variables}} with values (ask user if unknown)

execute-tags.tag: action xml tag → Perform the action
check if="condition" xml tag → Conditional block wrapping actions (requires closing </check>)
ask xml tag → Prompt user and WAIT for response
invoke-workflow xml tag → Execute another workflow with given inputs and the workflow.xml runner
invoke-task xml tag → Execute specified task
invoke-protocol name="protocol_name" xml tag → Execute reusable protocol from protocols section
goto step="x" → Jump to specified step

if.mandate: Save to file (Write first time, Edit subsequent)
if.ask:
[a] Advanced Elicitation, [c] Continue, [p] Party-Mode, [y] YOLO the rest of this document only. WAIT for response. Start the advanced elicitation workflow {project-root}/_bmad/core/workflows/advanced-elicitation/workflow.xml
Continue to next step
Start the party-mode workflow {project-root}/_bmad/core/workflows/party-mode/workflow.md
Enter #yolo mode for the rest of the workflow

substep.title: Step Completion
substep.check: If no special tags and NOT #yolo:

step.title: Completion
step.check: Confirm document saved to output path

execution-modes.mode: Full user interaction and confirmation of EVERY step at EVERY template output - NO EXCEPTIONS except yolo MODE
Skip all confirmations and elicitation, minimize prompts and try to produce all of the workflow automatically by simulating the remaining discussions with an simulated expert user

structural.tag: step n="X" goal="..." - Define step with number and goal

execution.tag: action if="condition" - Single conditional action (inline, no closing tag needed)
check if="condition">...</check> - Conditional block wrapping multiple items (closing tag required)
ask - Get user input (ALWAYS wait for response before continuing)
invoke-protocol - Execute a reusable protocol (e.g., discover_inputs)

protocols.desc: Reusable workflow protocols that can be invoked via invoke-protocol tag

protocol.name: discover_inputs
protocol.desc: Smart file discovery and loading based on input_file_patterns
protocol.objective: Intelligently load project files (whole or sharded) based on workflow's input_file_patterns configuration
protocol.critical: Only execute if workflow.yaml contains input_file_patterns section

step.title: Parse Input File Patterns
step.action: For each pattern group (prd, architecture, epics, etc.), note the load_strategy if present

check.action: Determine load_strategy from pattern config (defaults to FULL_LOAD if not specified)

strategy.name: FULL_LOAD
strategy.desc: Load ALL files in sharded directory - used for PRD, Architecture, UX, brownfield docs
strategy.action: Use glob pattern to find ALL .md files (e.g., "{output_folder}/*architecture*/*.md")
Concatenate content in logical order (index.md first if exists, then alphabetical)

strategy.name: SELECTIVE_LOAD
strategy.desc: Load specific shard using template variable - example: used for epics with {{epic_num}}
strategy.action: Check for template variables in sharded_single pattern (e.g., {{epic_num}})
If variable undefined, ask user for value OR infer from context
Resolve template to specific file path

strategy.name: INDEX_GUIDED
strategy.desc: Load index.md, analyze structure and description of each doc in the index, then intelligently load relevant docs
strategy.mandate: DO NOT BE LAZY - use best judgment to load documents that might have relevant information, even if only a 5% chance
strategy.action: Parse table of contents, links, section headers
Identify which linked/referenced documents are likely relevant
strategy.example: If workflow is about authentication and index shows "Auth Overview", "Payment Setup", "Deployment" → Load auth docs, consider deployment docs, skip payment
strategy.note: When in doubt, LOAD IT - context is valuable, being thorough is better than missing critical info

check.action: Mark pattern as RESOLVED, skip to next pattern

substep.title: Try Whole Document if No Sharded Found

check.if: no sharded matches found OR no sharded pattern exists

check.action: Load ALL matching files completely (no offset/limit)
Mark pattern as RESOLVED, skip to next pattern

check.if: no matches for sharded OR whole
check.action: Note in session: "No {pattern_name} files found" (not an error, just unavailable, offer use change to provide)

step.title: Report Discovery Results
step.action: List all loaded content variables with file counts
step.example: ✓ Loaded {prd_content} from 5 sharded files: prd/index.md, prd/requirements.md, ... ✓ Loaded {architecture_content} from 1 file: Architecture.md ✓ Loaded {epics_content} from selective load: epics/epic-3.md ○ No ux_design files found
step.note: This gives workflow transparency into what context is available

llm.critical-rules: • This is the complete workflow execution engine • You MUST Follow instructions exactly as written • The workflow execution engine is governed by: {project-root}/_bmad/core/tasks/workflow.xml • You MUST have already loaded and processed: {installed_path}/workflow.yaml • This workflow uses INTENT-DRIVEN PLANNING - adapt organically to product type and context • YOU ARE FACILITATING A CONVERSATION With a user to produce a final document step by step. The whole process is meant to be collaborative helping the user flesh out their ideas. Do not rush or optimize and skip any section.
